decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Gaea's Cradle and mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Ignoble Hierarch. The deck aims to control the board using cards like Endurance and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also utilizing Natural Order to cheat out powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary. The inclusion of cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Scythecat Cub provide additional ways to search for specific lands and creatures, allowing for a versatile and adaptable playstyle. Additionally, the deck utilizes unique cards like Lair of the Hydra and Talon Gates of Madara to further control the game and secure victory.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on a strategy that combines aggressive creatures with disruption to control the game. The deck includes a variety of creatures with abilities that disrupt your opponent's game plan, such as Skyclave Apparition and Flickerwisp. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and generate tempo advantages. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption while controlling the board with creature threats. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through card selection, card draw, and card advantage creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By efficiently managing resources and answering threats, the deck can outvalue the opponent and secure victory through attrition. The mana base is built to ensure consistency and access to all necessary colors for spells.

This deck utilizes the combo of Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield early. It includes a mix of control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo, as well as acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. Atraxa, Grand Unifier can be used as an alternative target for Show and Tell, while Sneak Attack provides an additional way to cheat creatures into play. The key strategy is to quickly put big threats into play and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize Cloudpost to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, allowing the player to cast large threats such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also includes powerful utility lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Bojuka Bog to control the board. Additionally, cards like Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time help to search for key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while disrupting their game plan with various control elements.

The deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic such as Force of Will and Daze. It aims to pressure the opponent's life total quickly with threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and card advantage. The use of Canadian Threshold mana base allows for consistency and flexibility in casting spells, making it a well-rounded aggro deck with a control element.

The deck focuses on locking down the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void, while ramping up quickly with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to play powerful threats like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. It also includes removal and burn spells like Fury and Shatterskull Smashing to control the board and finish off opponents quickly. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building a strong board presence to pressure them into a quick defeat.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt opponents through counter spells and removal while drawing cards and gaining card advantage. The deck aims to control the game tempo and board state with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce, while using efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide additional card advantage and threats, allowing the player to outvalue their opponent and ultimately win the game through attrition. The deck also utilizes lands like Karakas and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to pressure them. Utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. Alongside removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck can deal with opposing threats efficiently. The deck also includes strong threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to close out the game quickly. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive game plan and provide consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this Reanimator combo deck is to use cards like Entomb and Reanimate to quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By combining these powerful creatures with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans and quickly close out the game with aggressive threats. The deck also includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent for additional disruption and threats. The mana base includes dual lands like Underground Sea and fetch lands like Polluted Delta to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Unmask, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Shallow Grave. The goal is to combo off and overwhelm the opponent with big threats before they can respond, using efficient mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to execute the game plan quickly. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, Dress Down, and Consign to Memory to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Nulldrifter and Phyrexian Dreadnought to apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and eventually win the game through a combination of control and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt and control the opponent while maintaining a tempo advantage. This is achieved through a combination of disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Force of Will, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push. The deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with creatures like Murktide Regent and Troll of Khazad-dûm while also disrupting their game plan. The deck's mana base is built to support its dual-colored spells and maximize its ability to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's resources while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to apply pressure. Stock Up and Brainstorm help dig for key cards, while Daze and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's game plan. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Orcish Bowmasters offers removal. The deck aims to tempo out the opponent, using a combination of disruption and efficient threats to win the game quickly.

The central theme of this deck is to use the Painter's Servant cards in combination with cards like Grindstone and Goblin Welder to create a powerful combo that can quickly mill the opponent's library. By utilizing cards like Pyroblast and Lightning Bolt for control, as well as other artifact cards for support, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while executing its own win condition efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of various mana sources and utility lands like Urza's Saga and Ancient Tomb aim to provide consistent and flexible mana options for the deck.

The deck revolves around the synergy between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library in a single turn. It uses cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to constantly create artifacts on board to fuel the combo. Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal help accelerate the mana needed to execute the combo quickly. Control elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation are included to protect the combo pieces while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and disrupt the opponent's plans to win the game.
